Prompt: Ozawa Method is used to measure the electrical properties of the AM part.
Tolerance measurement is done before surface roughness measurement during AM part qualification.
CT-Scan and Neutron Imaging techniques are used to measure porosity and cracks.
Method E1876 is a standard test for Dynamic Young's Modulus, Shear Modulus, and Poisson's Ratio by Impulse Excitation of Vibration.
Method E1382 is used for Determining Average Grain Size.
Electron Backscatter Diffraction is used to measure microstructural properties of metal AM part.
Method E466 is used for Creep-Fatigue Testing.
ASTM E399 is a quality test method for linear-elastic plane-strain fracture toughness.
Method E1457 is used for creep-fatigue crack growth.
Hardness is considered as electrical properties of metal AM process.
Hardness measure is done before measuring fatigue strength and life.
What does Method E1457 measure? 1)creep crack growth 2)creep-fatigue crack growth
What does Method E1820 measure? 1) fracture toughness. 2) Linear-Elastic Plane-Strain Fracture Toughness
What does Method  E2714 measure? 1) Creep-Fatigue 2) Constant Amplitude Fatigue.
What does Method  E8 measure? 1) Tension Testing 2) Poisson's Ratio
What does Method  E2019 measure? 1) Temperature Limit of Flammability of Chemicals 2) Minimum Ignition Energy of a Dust Cloud in Air
